channel.title: How do i make perfect rings admin?
channel.description: How do I make perfect rings admin? plz help[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 16, 2008, 08:23:15 PM[/size][hr]I just need to know how to make them admin. Please help me i really need it.

item.title: How do i make perfect rings admin?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

How about you edit your item equipping method?

if(itemID == 773 && playerRights < 2)
{
sendMessage(“You cannot equip this item.”);
return;
}

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make perfect rings admin?

item.title: How do i make perfect rings admin?
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“Zypherx23x, post:7, topic:182072”][quote author=grahaam link=topic=243669.msg2058563#msg2058563 date=1203236583]

if (command.startsWith("ring") && playerRights >= 3) { addItem(773, 1); } if (command.startsWith("pickup 00773") && playerRights >= 2) { deleteItem(773,getItemSlot(773), 1); sendMessage("No perfect ring for you!"); } thats what i use i made it so only owners can pickup p rings

could try this

if (playerEquipment[playerRing] == 773 && playerRights >= 3) { deleteItem(773,getItemSlot(773), 1); sendMessage("No perfect ring for you!"); }
which probably won’t work cuz it deletes it in itemslot and im too lazy to figure it out

put these both in client.java with all ur other commands im not sure the playerequipment one will work
[/quote]
I cant find my commands. :p[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 16, 2008, 10:04:18 PM[/size][hr]Really i cant find my commands. How can i find them?[/quote]

Search for

customCommand(String command)

Put it with the other commands…

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make perfect rings admin?
item.dc:creator: @Zypherx23x Zypherx23x
item.description:
@Zypherx23x wrote:

Where do I put this

if (command.startsWith(“ring”) && playerRights >= 3) {
addItem(773, 1);
}
if (command.startsWith(“pickup 00773”) && playerRights >= 2) {
deleteItem(773,getItemSlot(773), 1);
sendMessage(“No perfect ring for you!”);
}

Read full topic
